TEXT_EMAIL_CONFIG_INFO: The following is configuration for how emails should look when FastComments sends emails to your commenters. You don't have to enter anything if you don't want to customize this.
TEXT_FROM_NAME_EMAIL_NOTE: Note: From-Name and Email settings do not affect emails sent to administrators.
TITLE_AUTO_ADDED: Automatically added during trial period based on traffic to your account. This is done to ease setup, and only happens during the trial period.
TEXT_EMAIL_ERROR: Something looks wrong with this email. We've saved any other changes.
TEXT_NO_DOMAINS_WARNING: Whoa! You have no domains. Your widgets will not be able to load until you associate one or more domains with your account.
TEXT_DKIM_EXPLANATION: DKIM signs outgoing emails so recipients can verify they came from your domain. This improves deliverability and prevents spoofing.
TEXT_DKIM_KEYS_GENERATED: DKIM keys have been generated. Add the following DNS records to your domain.
TEXT_DMARC_EXPLANATION: DMARC tells receiving mail servers how to handle emails that fail authentication checks. The recommended policy below is a good starting point.
TEXT_DNS_PROPAGATION_NOTE: DNS changes can take up to 48 hours to propagate. If verification fails, please wait and try again.
TEXT_DKIM_GENERATE_ERROR: Failed to generate DKIM keys. Please try again.
TEXT_DNS_VERIFY_ERROR: Failed to verify DNS records. Please try again.
CONFIRM_REGENERATE_DKIM: Are you sure? Regenerating DKIM keys will immediately invalidate your current keys. Emails sent before DNS propagation completes (up to 48 hours) will fail DKIM verification. You will need to update your DNS TXT records with the new values.
TEXT_DKIM_RATE_LIMITED: Too many key generation requests. Please try again later.
TEXT_DMARC_ALREADY_CONFIGURED: A DMARC record is already configured for this domain. No changes needed.
TEXT_DMARC_RUA_NOTE: Tip: Consider adding rua=mailto:you@example.com to your DMARC record to receive aggregate reports about email authentication results for your domain.
TEXT_SPF_NOTE: SPF is handled by FastComments sending infrastructure, no SPF changes are needed on your domain.
